citation.journal: Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society
citation.title: Asteroseismic measurement of surface-to-core rotation in a main-sequence A star, KIC 11145123

news.title: Distant star is roundest object ever observed in nature
news.summary: Stars are not perfect spheres; several mechanisms can change their shape. One mechanism is rotation: the more quickly a star rotates, the more flat it becomes due to the centrifugal force.

news.title: Astronomers Measure Kepler 11145123 with Unprecedented Precision
news.summary: The star Kepler 11145123 is the roundest natural object ever measured in the universe.

news.title: Kepler 11145123 is Most Spherical Natural Object Ever Seen, Astronomers Say | Astronomy | Sci-News.com
news.summary: Kepler 11145123, a slowly rotating star roughly 5,000 light-years away, is the most spherical natural object ever measured, more spherical than the Sun, says an international team of astronomers.

news.title: Roundest known space object discovered
news.summary: 04:18 pm FOLLOW US: Berlin: Astronomers claim to have discovered the roundest natural object in space ever measured – a slowly rotating star 5,000 light years away from the Earth.
